results.title: Dead End Drive-in (AFC)
results.creator_credit: Brian Trenchard-Smith, A Williams, New South Wales Film Corporation and Springvale Productions
results.brief_description: Futuristic satirical comedy which revolves around the use of drive-in theatres as internment camps for outcasts from society where the unemployed and weak are fed junk food, music and bad films. When the film’s main character finds himself there by accident, he is obsessed by a desire to escape and find a new sense of purpose in his life.

results.title: Our land, our truth = Debout sur leur terre
results.creator_credit: Maurice Bulbulian, Jean Dansereau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Made in collaboration with the Inuit Tungavingat Nunamini, this film focuses on those dissident members of the Inuit community who rejected the agreement signed on November 11, l975, between the Northern Quebec Inuit Association, the Quebec and federal governments, the James Bay Energy Corporation, the James Bay Development Corporation, Hydro-Quebec and the Grand Council of the Crees, which took away Native rights to a territory of almost one million square kilometres. By their words and actions, the dissident Inuit of Povungnituk, Ivujivik and Sugluk express their strong desire to retain their land and their traditions. The filmmakers go into their homes, on the ice and the sea to record first-hand the lives of these northern people. In French and Inuit with no subtitles.

results.title: Our land is our life
results.creator_credit: Boyce Richardson, Tony Ianzelo, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In March, 1974, the Cree Indian people of the Mistassini area in northern Quebec met to discuss their long-term future. After three hundred years of minimal contact with the white man, they had been offered “compensation” by the government of Quebec for the effects of the James Bay power project. But they decided that nothing, neither jobs nor money, meant more to them than their land. The film presents the issues under these headings: The Conflict, The Hunting Culture, The Schools, The Village, The Fight for the Land. Narrated by Walter Massey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Boyce Richardson, Tony Ianzelo, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Our house
results.creator_credit: Meema Spadola, Independent Television Service and Sugar Pictures
results.brief_description: This US documentary profiles children in five diverse families as they face the challenges and joys of growing up in gay/lesbian households. An inspiring and warming exploration of what family values really should be about. The five families come from diverse socio-economic, racial and religious backgrounds across the USA.

results.title: Our Mutual friend
results.creator_credit: Julian Farino, Catherine Wearing and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Based on Charles Dickens last completed novel, this production paints a sweeping picture of London in the 19th century. With its themes of class war, sexual jealousy and overwhelming passion, it is a tale that is as relevant today as when Dickens first penned it.
results.description: Based on Charles Dickens last completed novel, this production paints a sweeping picture of London in the 19th century. With its themes of class war, sexual jealousy and overwhelming passion, it is a tale that is as relevant today as when Dickens first penned it.

results.title: Our land, our water
results.creator_credit: John King, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A satirical presentation of the exploitation of resources of land, water and people, with the difficulties of satisfying conflicting needs. The responsibility to all users is raised, with the needs of the future in mind. Cast includes Stephen Tozer, Marjorie Brooke-White, Bob Walker, Allan Richards, Kenneth R. Hobman.

results.title: Days of reckoning
results.creator_credit: Ron Tanner, Lloyds Bank and Millbank Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Starting your own business”.
The third and final part of the series, Starting Your Own Business which traces the fortunes of three people starting their own businesses. Examines the only surviving member of the trio, an engineer whose business is in its third year. He is presented with the opportunity to expand and must reach a quick decision. Focuses on forward planning and monitoring performance.

results.title: Otway countdown
results.creator_credit: John Bird, Don Dennett and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A student production making a clear statement of the conservationists viewpoint of clearfelling and woodchopping of valuable native forests. It examines the history of the Otways and argues strongly against current practices. This film could be used in conjunction with films and resources giving the alternative viewpoints to stimulate debate on resource management.

results.title: Day of the dead (D)
results.creator_credit: George A. Romero, Richard Rubinstein, Laurel Productions and United Film Distribution Company
results.brief_description: The third and bleakest of George A. Romero’s ‘Living dead’ series (which consist of ‘Night of the living dead’ and ‘Dawn of the dead’), is also the most goriest. Essentially, society has collapsed and the living dead have taken over the world. The film picks up on a small group of survivors, made up of scientists and a small band of soldiers who have barricaded themselves in an abandoned missile silo. The scientists desperately search for a solution to the zombie plague, while the military become increasingly agitated at their lack of results. Like Romero’s previous outings into the world of the undead, the varied groups are microcosms of human nature and not surprisingly, the most unpleasant characters in this film are not the zombies but the humans themselves. Cast includes Lori Cardille, Terry Alexander, Joe Pilato, Richard Liberty and Howard Sherman.

results.title: Davy Crockett: king of the wild frontier
results.creator_credit: Norman Foster, Bill Walsh and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Davy Crockett was a legendary folk hero. Starring Fess Parker as Crockett, the hero fights alligators, battles an Indian Chief in a savage tomahawk duel and fights for freedom at the ill-fated Alamo. Accompanied by his friend George Russell, played by Buddy Ebsen, “Davy Crockett” is a daring adventure of drama, humour and excitement and will remain a colourful portrayal of the frontier.
